page.title: 12Helion's Bumpstead, cont.
page.content: south, beyond the pub is a{Grade 1 {Protected Lane}which ranks it among the best in the country and therefore of national importance. The name {Bumpstead}is thought to mean "the place where the rushes or reeds grow" and{Helions}comes from the place of origin-{Hellean in Brittany-}of the Domesday holder of the manor of Helions. Helions Farm and Wiggens farm are{moated farms.}The{population}for Helions bumpstead in 1961 was 366 and in 1971 the population was 364.There is very little{employment}in Helions so some people go to Haverhill and some travel to London to work.{School children go to Steeple Bumpstead C.P. School and then to Sible Hedingham Comprehensive. Over 60% of people own their own car.The Village has a W.I., an elderly persons club and a mothers and toddlers group.
